benchmark_details.name: Larth: Dataset and Machine Translation for Etruscan
benchmark_details.overview: We propose a dataset for machine translation from Etruscan to English, which contains 2891 translated examples from existing academic sources. This dataset can help enable future research on this language and similar low-resource languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a usable corpus from Etruscan inscriptions for natural language processing and evaluate neural models for translation from Etruscan to English.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is limited in size and may not contain comprehensive coverage of all Etruscan texts.

data.source: The dataset includes Etruscan texts extracted from academic resources such as ETP, CIEP, and Zikh Rasna.
data.annotation: Data is manually and automatically annotated, with translations provided for each example.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on n-grams matching between the machine-translated and reference translations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher BLEU and chr-F scores indicate better translation quality, while lower TER scores indicate fewer edits needed.
methodology.baseline_results: A small transformer model achieved a BLEU score of 10.1 on the dataset.
methodology.validation: The training and validation splits are created from the available examples, typically using an 80/20 split.
